name: 'King of the Hill' - Bobby Hill Quiz | Television | 10 Questions
tags: 'King Of The Hill' - Characters and Actors

questions.text: Bobby Hill is clever, quirky and insightful.  He is the son of Peggy and Hank Hill.  Is Bobby (or Robert) his birth given name?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Indeed, his full name is Robert Jeffrey Hill, and 'Bobby' is the common shortened nickname for Robert.  Bobby is an interesting character because he seems to provide a balance between his salt-of-the-earth father and his mother, who often has her head floating in the clouds.  Like Ralph Wiggum from 'The Simpsons', Bobby is known for saying curious things, sometimes complete non sequiturs.

questions.text: Bobby Hill is played by a female voice actor, which shouldn't be surprising for animated TV addicts.  Who provides the excellent voice behind Bobby?
questions.explanation:
Pamela Segall.

	Also known by her married name, Pamela Adlon, Segall has had a long career in Hollywood, beginning as a child actress in the movie 'Grease II', wherein she played Dolores Rebchuck.  She also appeared in movies such as 'Say Anything...' and 'The Adventures of Ford Fairlane'.  Since 1997, she has appeared primarily as a voice actor.

questions.text: Bobby Hill is a perennial 13-year old.  That being said, what is the name of the middle school that Bobby seems to endlessly attend?
questions.explanation:
Tom Landry Middle School.

	Bobby attends the same school at which his mother works occasionally as a substitute teacher (and, in one episode, where his father also worked as a substitute teacher).  Tom Landry is named for Hank Hill's hero, the former coach of the Dallas Cowboys.

questions.text: During the run of 'King of the Hill', Bobby has had several youthful encounters with girls, but none have been more important in his life than his Laotian next door neighbor.  What is the name of this young lady who has been Bobby's girlfriend several times?
questions.explanation:
Connie.

	Kahn Souphanousinphone, Jr., aka Connie, is the daughter of Laotian parents who moved originally to Anaheim before migrating east to Arlen, Texas.  Connie is a very precocious youngster, skilled on the violin and scoring high marks in her various classes.

questions.text: Bobby's best friend is the son of the next door neighbors, Nancy and Dale Gribble.  What is the name of this boy who seems to be maturing at a much faster rate than Bobby?
questions.explanation:
Joseph.

	Joseph Gribble is also a 13-year old, but he seems to be hitting puberty before Bobby.  Joseph is a very awkward kid who has trouble meeting girls.  Often, he has used Bobby as a springboard for encounters with the opposite sex.  Though Joseph is accepted as the son of Dale and Nancy, insider information suggests that he is really the son of John Redcorn.

questions.text: Bobby's father Hank desperately wants his son to be an athlete, but Bobby never seems to have much success on any of the teams for which he plays.  What sport does Bobby play that Hank actually disapproves of?
questions.explanation:
Soccer.

	In various episodes we see Bobby playing baseball, wrestling and playing football, much to Hank's approval.  However, Hank firmly disapproves of the only sport that Bobby seems to really savor, soccer.  Hank especially dislikes the fact that Bobby's soccer coach doesn't encourage actual winning.

questions.text: Bobby has expressed several different career aspirations during the run of 'King of the Hill', but one springs up more than any other.  What is this intended career of Bobby Hill?
questions.explanation:
Comedian.

	In various episodes, Bobby has expressed interest in runway modelling, propane salesmanship and proctology, but it's as a comedian that Bobby Hill will truly be happy.  In one episode, Bobby responds to his father, who is concerned about the boy doing drugs, 'Look, dad, I'm not gonna do drugs. I want to be the first chubby comedian to live past 35.'  In another episode, Bobby sells a joke to Yakov Smirnoff!

questions.text: Bobby Hill has had several occupations during the run of 'King of the Hill'.  Which of these odd jobs did Bobby once have in a certain episode?
questions.explanation:
Rodeo clown.

	Bobby has worked as a concession seller and a child model, among other things, but he seemed most confortable during his brief stint as a rodeo clown.  While he was working as a clown, he walked around in front of the stands saying one of his catchphrases, 'What are you talking about?'

questions.text: The mildy rotund Bobby Hill is a connoisseur of many fine foods, but none seem to turn him on more than which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Fruit pies.

	Bobby's favorite food is fruit pies, with burritos perhaps being a distant second.  In one episode, Bobby was quoted as saying, 'You had me at fruit pies...' (in an obvious spoof of the movie 'Jerry Maguire').

questions.text: And now for a final toughie: In one episode, it is determined by several Buddhist priests that Bobby may be a reincarnated lama.  What is the name of this lama?
questions.explanation:
Sanglug.

	This episode brings us one of my favorite quotes by Peggy Hill about her son Bobby.  After learning that her son may be a reincarnated lama, the prideful Peggy is driving along, when she sees one of those obnoxious 'My child is an honor roll student' bumper stickers.  Peggy reacts to the driver of that car by screaming: 'Oh yeah? Well my child is God to billions of Asians!'
